header.title: The Scroll of Set (Issue 145, Volume XXII-3, June 1996)
header.category: Western Esotericism, Occultism, Setian Magic, Modern Magical Practice

central_thesis: The core of Setian magic is Xeper, defined as 'I Have Come Into Being,' a discrete, past event of self-creation and divine action that modifies one's current state. This individualistic path of conscious evolution, or 'Becoming,' is achieved through understanding and applying principles like resonance, synchronicity, and the balance of reflective ('Gift of Set') and active ('HarWer/Horus') consciousness, while actively seeking and transforming 'resistance' (Nyd) with Will (Thelema).

structure_content.summary: This article defines Xeper as a first-person, stative verb meaning 'I Have Come Into Being,' referring to discrete, past divine moments of self-creation and limitation. It's not a continuous process but a series of events sensed through reason or divine apprehension (næsis). Methods for experiencing Xeper include identifying peak experiences, observing life patterns, and ritual enactment. The noun Xeper signifies the 'manifestation' or 'thing that happened,' representing the sum of one's wrought changes and the extension of existence to a higher level. Xeperi, the dual noun, refers to 'synchronicity' or 'miracle' when two discrete systems resonate.

structure_content.chapter_title: [3] Sinister Seas - by Clayton Bozeman II°, Order of Leviathan
structure_content.summary: This article explores 'places of power' conducive to magic, specifically the Bermuda Triangle (re-termed Bermuda Trapezium) and its Pacific counterpart. These locations are suggested to accumulate 'random GBM' (Great Black Magic), making them adaptable for Setian purposes of 'Remanifesting the Atlantean' and consciously 'surfacing' on Florida's East coast, linking to the broader themes of Xeper and Remanifestation.

structure_content.chapter_title: [5] Complacency: A Perspective - by Marie Buckner II°
structure_content.summary: A personal account detailing the author's arrest due to complacency, serving as a cautionary tale for Initiates. It emphasizes that initiation is not a 'cake walk' and underscores the importance of self-awareness and avoiding overconfidence, highlighting how 'innocent circumstances' can appear as 'flagrante delicto' to others, and the profound value of freedom when it is lost.

structure_content.chapter_title: [6] Honoring the Difficult - by Dedra Burch II°
structure_content.summary: This article describes the increased discomfort and accelerated pace of transformation experienced at higher initiatory degrees (Adept II° vs. Setian I°). It posits that facing this 'uncomfortableness' and 'honoring the difficult' by staying focused and confronting one's reflection is crucial for profound Xeper, rather than avoiding the intense changes.

structure_content.chapter_title: [7] Xeper Day - by Don Webb V°
structure_content.summary: A Temple-wide ritual for the re-Utterance of Xeper on August 6, 1996. It involves performing a deliberate, Xeper-motivated action; visualizing a symbolic line connecting the action's location to another personal Xeper spot at a different latitude, imbued with the feeling of the action; and concluding with the affirmation 'I Have Come Into Being, and by the process of my Coming Into Being, the process of Coming Into Being is established.'

structure_content.chapter_title: [8] Magical Resonance and Synchronous Manifestation - by Roger R. Whitaker III°
structure_content.summary: This article defines 'resonance' as the prolongation or increase through sympathetic vibration, occurring at 'unison' or 'harmonic' frequencies. It links resonance to energy, movement, and the ability of LHP Initiates to collectively extend their perceptual vision into cultural memetics, ensuring the 'survival ability' and 'prolongation' of the Setian Path. It asserts that conscious manifestation utilizes these resonant principles.

structure_content.chapter_title: [9] Strange Bedfellows - by James Graeb III°
structure_content.summary: This article connects Sartre's philosophical concepts of 'being-for-itself' (human consciousness as nothingness/void) and 'being-in-itself' (animate/inanimate nature) to Setian philosophy. The 'Gift of Set' is equated with reflective consciousness, the origin of negation, and the 'Void in which true Creation could take form.' 'HarWer' or 'Horus' consciousness represents 'consciousness in action.' The balance and union ('coniunctio') of Set and Horus, as celebrated in the Heb Sed festival, are presented as essential for the incarnate Setian to interact effectively with the world.

structure_content.chapter_title: [10] Harmonic Proportion in Ritual - by Roger Whitaker III°
structure_content.summary: Building on resonance, this article posits that angularism and the pentagram are key components in Setian magic, representing an underlying resonant structure that connects the ritualist to phenomenal activity. The Temple of Set's philosophy enables Xeper, allowing for different perceptions of reality. Harmonic ritualization creates environments conducive to personal change and the enhancement of initiatory processes, etching self-consciousness into the present through mathematical, harmonic elements.

structure_content.chapter_title: [12] 'Ta Ankh' - To Keep Alive - by Ruth Nielsen III°
structure_content.summary: This article introduces the 'Ta Ankh' ritual and sacred oil, developed as a Setian act of balance for 'Remanifesting the harmony, beauty, and life-sustaining nature of our planet Earth.' It connects Xeper to Earth's sustenance, emphasizing responsible stewardship and the ability of Setians to work with (rather than fear) chaotic forces. The ritual calls for collective participation, using anointing oil and imbued water to infuse will for Earth healing.

structure_content.chapter_title: [15] Resistance - by Matthew M. Mitchem II°
structure_content.summary: This article analyzes 'Nyd' or 'resistance' as the greatest adversity in the Setian path. Overcoming this resistance through Will (Thelema) leads to initiation (Remanifestation) into the unknown (Runa) and greater efficacy in Xeper. Resistance manifests both objectively (world challenges) and subjectively (self-imposed limitations/passions). Recognizing and transforming resistance into a source of strength and 'help' is key to personal evolution and the 'brightening of Set's flame.'

structure_content.chapter_title: [18] Overheard at the Austin Conclave - collected by Rosemary Webb III°
structure_content.summary: A collection of humorous and insightful quotes overheard at a Setian conclave, offering a glimpse into the informal culture and internal discourse of the Temple of Set members.

structure_content.chapter_title: [20] Caribbean Cat Tales - by Maria Hunt II°
structure_content.summary: A reflective piece drawing lessons from observing cats in St. Croix, relating their natural adaptability, pursuit of freedom, and teamwork to Setian concepts. It emphasizes that for the Elect, survival extends to mind and spirit, requiring introspection ('Look within your fears'), embracing 'Change,' and valuing 'Solitude' to achieve new plateaus of aloneness and manifest isolate intelligence.

structure_content.chapter_title: [23] A Passing-By - by Michael A. Aquino VI°
structure_content.summary: This article announces Michael A. Aquino's retirement as High Priest of Set, reflecting on his role and the nature of the High Priesthood as a temporary station. It emphasizes the Temple's unique role in restoring awareness of individual consciousness amidst societal changes and its function as a 'magical mirror' and 'tool of convenience' for bridging magic, næsis, and science.

key_concepts.definition: Derived from Egyptian, translated as 'I Have Come Into Being.' It refers to a discrete, past event that modifies a current state, a 'divine moment' where the individual acts as a god, both limiting and creating themselves. It is not a continuous process but a series of such events, individualistic in nature, detected through introspection or divine apprehension.

Translated as 'manifestation' or 'the thing that happened.' It represents the extension of existence to a further level of being, encompassing all the changes, recognition, and reputation one has wrought in life, functioning as a 'giant talisman' that attracts future experiences and forms divine memory.
Translated as 'synchronicity' or 'miracle.' It occurs when two discrete systems resonate with one another, signifying a meaningful coincidence or 'action at a distance,' which is understood as magic.

The process of initiation and becoming, often achieved by overcoming resistance (Nyd). It is the 're-Utterance of Xeper' and the renewed manifestation of the self that occurs each time resistance is overcome.

A phenomenon where a source's energy is prolonged or increased through sympathetic vibration in a receptor, either at the same vibratory rate ('unison') or a harmonic pitch (a proportional ratio). In Setian magic, it allows for the extension of a source's influence and conscious manifestation by achieving synchronicity.

The ability to move 'in the proper period,' aligning with the oscillatory motions of a manifestation or source. It is achieved when a receptor resonates with its source, ensuring an additive effect that prolongs the original source or phenomenon.

Corresponds to the unique self-reflective consciousness of the individual, serving as the 'origin of negation' and the 'Void in which true Creation could take form.' It is the capacity for introspection and abstract thought.

Corresponds to action-oriented consciousness, characterized by drive, power, and immediate engagement with the world, distinct from pure reflective thought. It represents the active, assertive aspect of the Setian. Referred to as 'will' in Thelemic context.

The essential union and balance of reflective consciousness (Gift of Set) and consciousness in action (HarWer/Horus). This alchemical joinder, celebrated in the Heb Sed festival, is crucial for the incarnate Setian to effectively apprehend the world and act upon it, deriving much strength from this double aspect.

An Old English Rune meaning 'need' or 'resistance.' It is considered the greatest adversity to be overcome by Will (Thelema) during the process of Becoming (Xeper) to experience initiation (Remanifestation). Resistance can be objective (world challenges) or subjective (self-imposed limitations or passions).

A key component in Setian ritual and magic, representing an underlying resonant structure upon which Setian magic is based. The pentagram acts as a way for the Prince of Darkness to sense Initiates, and its harmonic elements enhance initiatory processes and shape atmospheric conditions conducive to Xeper.

practical_system.description: The Setian magical system is fundamentally an operative path of individual self-creation and conscious evolution (Xeper), moving towards divinity. It emphasizes the active transformation of one's current state through 'divine moments' of willed action. This process is driven by understanding and leveraging 'resonance' and 'synchronicity' – the sympathetic alignment of energies to prolong and extend magical influence. Practitioners balance 'reflective consciousness' (Gift of Set) with 'consciousness in action' (HarWer/Horus) to effectively interact with and reshape reality. Overcoming 'resistance' (Nyd) through 'Will' (Thelema) is integral to progression and 'Remanifestation.' The system involves both personal introspection and structured ritual work to create environments conducive to Xeper and extend Setian influence into the world.
tools: Xeper (as a conceptual tool for self-definition and action)
Will (Thelema) as the driving force for overcoming adversity and enacting change
Magical Introspection, Observation, and Skepticism for understanding Xeper moments
Ritual Chamber: Harmonically proportioned elements (visual, audio, tactile, olfactory, wave phenomena) within a ritual space, synthesized by attributed meanings to aid Essence development
Pentagram/Angularism: A key resonant structure for Setian magic, a way for the Prince of Darkness to sense Initiates
'Ta Ankh' Anointing Oil: A sacred oil (pure essential oils) used in Earth healing rituals
Coniunctio of Set and Horus: The balanced state of reflective and active consciousness as an internal magical tool for effective operation
rituals: Xeper Day Ritual: Perform a Xeper-motivated action (e.g., starting a book, filing divorce papers, writing a letter) on August 6th, visualize a line connecting the action's location to a symbolic personal Xeper spot at a different latitude, imbue this line with the emotional feeling from the action, and audibly affirm the Xepera Xeper Xeperu statement.

'Ta Ankh' Ritual for Earth Healing: A ritual designed to balance and remanifest harmony on Earth. It involves using 'Ta Ankh' anointing oil (one drop in water), imbuing the water with personal will, sprinkling it on participants and the Earth, and honoring Shu, Tefnut, Geb, and Nuit. Recommended for collective performance during full moons, equinoxes, and solstices.

General Magical Practice: Engaging in magical introspection to detect divine experiences and patterns in one's life. Ritually enacting desired moments to produce specific limitations and creations. Utilizing angularism and the pentagram within ritual environments to enhance initiatory processes and establish a resonant connection with the Prince of Darkness.

relevant_quotes.text: The proper translation of the verb Xeper is “I Have Come Into Being”.
Xeper the noun is the extension of existence to a further level of being.
The noun Xeperi can best be translated by “synchronicity”, although the standard translation is “miracle”. Xeper has occurred when two discrete systems resonate with one another.
Xepera Xeper Xeperu (“I Have Come Into Being; and by the process of my Coming Into Being, the process of Coming Into Being is established.”).

The Temple of Set as an institution is the only organized group whose philosophy and magical practices have the capability to utilize the current of that premise in a conscious and well-thought-out manner. It is there for our harvest.
Set, or more properly the Gift of Set, corresponds to the reflective consciousness of the individual. ... HarWer or Horus would correspond to consciousness in action.
The union of Set and Horus occurred at the Heb Sed festival. ... It was from the coniunctio of Set and Horus that much of the strength of Egypt was derived.
“Need” is our greatest adversity. Once overcome by Will (Thelema) in the process of Becoming (Xeper), we experience initiation (Remanifestation) further into the unknown (Runa).

The Temple and Æon of Set are similarly mandated by the transcendent principle of what Eric Hoffer called "the unnaturalness of human nature”, as well as by the capacity and drive of this “unnature” to evolve towards divinity: Xeper.

Black Magical initiation leads us to new plateaus of aloneness (not necessarily loneliness). The Gift of Isolate Intelligence gives us the potential to quite literally become the center of the Universe. In so becoming, we learn of the absolute impermanence of everything else in the Universe other than the absolute uniqueness of our own isolate perspective.

critical_analysis.relevance: This collection from 'The Scroll of Set' is a foundational text for understanding the philosophical and practical dimensions of Setian magic as conceptualized and practiced by the Temple of Set in the mid-1990s. It deeply elaborates on 'Xeper' as the central tenet of conscious self-creation, distinguishing Setianism from other magical paths. The articles provide technical definitions for key concepts (resonance, synchronicity, Set/Horus coniunctio, Nyd) and outline specific ritual practices, making it highly relevant for practitioners and scholars of modern Western Esotericism, especially within the Left-Hand Path traditions. It contextualizes Setian ideas within philosophical frameworks (Sartre) and ancient Egyptian symbolism, demonstrating a coherent and evolving magical system.
critical_analysis.target_audience: The primary target audience is Initiates and practitioners within the Temple of Set, as the articles assume familiarity with internal terminology, degrees, and philosophical context. Beyond this, it serves as a valuable resource for academic researchers and advanced practitioners of Western Esotericism, Occultism, and Left-Hand Path traditions who seek to understand the specific theoretical and operative mechanics of Setian magic. The detailed explanations of magical principles and ritual instructions cater to those committed to an in-depth study and practice of self-deification through conscious evolution.
